abstract: Clearly, it’s an ugly market out there, with the Dow Jones industrial average under 7,000 and the S&P 500 under 700. Despite that, we haven’t heard many stories about disgruntled investors going ballistic on the people who sold them whatever stock, mutual fund or other investment is in the dumps.
lead_paragraph: Clearly, it’s an ugly market out there, with the Dow Jones industrial average under 7,000 and the S&P 500 under 700. Despite that, we haven’t heard many stories about disgruntled investors going ballistic on the people who sold them whatever stock, mutual fund or other investment is in the dumps.

headline.main: For Ameriprise, Safety Starts at Home

abstract: The Fed chairman called for a broad reworking of how the government regulates the financial system to prevent future collapses.
snippet: The Fed chairman called for a broad reworking of how the government regulates the financial system to prevent future collapses.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  The chairman of the Federal Reserve, Ben S. Bernanke, called on Tuesday for a broad overhaul of financial regulation that would include a powerful new regulator to keep a much tighter grip on institutions considered “too big to fail.”

headline.main: Bernanke Says Financial Rules Need an Overhaul
headline.print_headline: Fed Chairman Calls for a Regulator to Rein In Entities ‘Too Big to Fail’
